results.title: The Marvellous march of Jean Francois
results.creator_credit: Sterling International, Israel M. Berman and Witold Giersz
results.brief_description: The wonderful adventures of Jean Francois, a small drummer boy in Napoleon’s Grande Armee. Ingenuity and steadfastness lead Jean Francois around the world and through the peril of war and the elements back to his homeland.

results.title: The Marriage of the blessed = Arusi-ye khuban [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Farabi Cinema Foundation and Mohsen Makhmalbaf
results.brief_description: This is an extremely confronting and at times disturbing film exploring the psychological torture of a shell-shocked war photojournalist and his attempts to come to grips with reality on returning home from the Iran-Iraq war front. After spending some time rehabilitating in a hospital mental asylum in Tehran, Haji (Mahmud Bigham) is finally released to the care of his fiancee Mehri (Roya Nonahali) and her family. However Haji is continually haunted with images of war and daily life becomes a struggle sending Haji into a downward spiral emotionally and psychologically. Mehri, who shares Haji’s passion for photography, tries in her own way to assist Haji in his recovery surrounding him with positive images of life whilst also pushing for their wedding ceremony to take place against her family’s wishes who now want to cancel the marriage. When Haji is given back his old job at the local newspaper, both he and Mehri take to the streets of Tehran with their cameras capturing images of the homeless, the drug addicts and prostitutes, and the oppressive poverty that exists post-revolution Iran. Haji’s boss, however, is not interested in social issues and refuses to print the photos leading to a tragic sequence of events for Haji and Mehri, and Haji’s eventual breakdown. Using evocative sounds and images, Makhmalbaf (Kandahar, Gabbeh) has created an amazing piece of experimental and controversial filmmaking in “The Marriage of the blessed” which for all its political and social commentary, managed to escape the religious censorship by the Iranian regime of the time. Cast includes Mohsen Zehtab, Ebrahim Abadi, Hossein Moslemi with cinemaphotography by Ali Reza Zarindest. In Farsi with English subtitles. NOTE: Contains disturbing war images.

results.title: The Marriage of Figaro = Le Nozze di Figaro
results.creator_credit: Southern Television, Glyndebourne Festival Productions, Humphrey Burton and Dave Heather
results.brief_description: The Marriage of Figaro, a comic opera in four acts by W.A. Mozart, text by da Ponte, based on Beaumarchais’ sequel to his Barber of Seville, recorded for television in front of a live audience at Glyndebourne in 1973 and produced by Peter Hall as part of the Glyndebourne Festival series. Highly acclaimed performances by an international cast including Knut Skram as Figaro, Ileana Cotrubas as Susanna, Benjamin Luxon as Count Almaviva and Kiri Te Kanawa as Countess Almaviva, supported by Frederica Von Stade, Marius Rintzler, Nucci Condo and John Fryatt, with the London Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by John Pritchard. Sung in Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: The Marquise of O... = Die Marquise von O...
results.creator_credit: Janus Film, Les Films du Losange, Klaus Hellwig, Barbet Schroeder and Eric Rohmer
results.brief_description: In a move away from his apparently casual use of contemporary French settings, Rohmer presents this German costume drama, a faithful adaptation of Heinrich von Kleist’s novella. While echoing Kleist’s ironic standpoint on the absurd severities of convention, Rohmer quite justifiably distances himself from the period. Emoting with hieratic gestures inappropriate to their rigidly suppresed inner feelings and desires, his characters are gently and exquisitely funny. Yet by the same token, evolving against simple, uncluttered backgrounds that contrive to suggest the setting for some classical tragedy, they are also infinitely moving. Winner of the Special Jury Prize at Cannes in 1976 the film stars Bruno Ganz and Edith Clever and has outstanding photography by Nestor Almendros. German language with English subtitles.

results.title: The Market economy: A matter of choice
results.brief_description: Shows how the competitive market system satisfies the needs of consumers in our modern economy. It looks at the market economy in Australia with the traditional Keynesian interpretation.

results.title: The Mark of the Hand : Aubrey Williams
results.creator_credit: Henry Martin, Kuumba Productions and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: The film follows Aubrey Williams to Georgetown, the capital city of Guyana, where he is to restore one of his murals. But this visit is special as Aubrey is to travel on to Hosororo in the far north-west of the country, where forty years earlier he worked as an agricultural officer. It was then that he first came into contact with pre-Columbian art in the form of rock painting or “Timehri”, an Arawak word that translates literally as “the mark of the hand”. His experiences there were decisive in forming his identity as a painter and have remained a creative source for his paintings.

results.title: The Maritime provinces of Canada
results.brief_description: A study of maritime provinces of Canada in relation to the rest of Canada and t the United States of America. Fishing, fur-farming, together with population distribution and a glimpse of the history of each settlement. The emphasis is placed on fishing off the coastline of Prince Edward island, and lumbering in new Brunswick.

results.title: The Marist way
results.brief_description: Locally produced documentary promoting the virtues of the monastic life, and teaching methods practise by the Marist Order. The film details the rigorous regime of scholastic, spiritual and athletic training the Brothers apply to their words in boarding schools across Australia. In conclusion, it asks which of their charges will assume their monastic vocation.
